intro: Euryops evansii subsp. evansii, commonly known as the Evans' starburster, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered blooms throughout the growing season. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience in arid environments.
